User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110503 Firefox/6.0a1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110503 Firefox/6.0a1

Open in New Tab for apptabs should open the new tab at the end of the tabstrip.
usually newer tabs are near the end of tabstrip.
It is annoying for the tabstrip to scroll back automatically to the front.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
Make sure you have many normal tabs that overflow the tabstrip.
1. Pin an app tab
2. Middle click a link


Actual Results:  
The new tab opens at the front of the tabstrip

Expected Results:  
The new tab opens at the end of the tabstrip

I think firefox should just separate the tabstrip for normal tabs and app tabs and render them on the same line, instead of applying attributes/classes to style them differently.  this will allow also scrolling for both normal tabs and app tabs.
comments.creator: henry.fai.hang.chan@gmail.com

comments.text:
Created attachment 9137937
Bug 655445 - Add setting to control position of tabs opened from pinned tabs.


This patch introduces `browser.tabs.insertAfterCurrentExceptPinned`.
Setting it to `true` open links from pinned tabs at the end of the tabbar.
